attributes.action: Stop OFQUAL changing the GCSE examination criteria mid Course.
attributes.additional_details:
OFQUAL have changed the marking criteria of the GCSE English Language syllabus for pupils mid-way through their course. OFQUAL are penalising pupils and teachers who have undertaken examinations in good faith.

This sets a precedent and clearly undermines their stated goal, as quoted from their Vision Statement:-

The public confidence objective: to promote public confidence in National Assessment arrangements.

How can we have confidence in a system that has been validated but changes the “goal posts” half way through a cohort.  If changes are required to a syllabus then due process should be followed and the new cohort undertake any changes that have been ratified.

Therefore this e-petition has been raised so that OFQUAL is not allowed to change marking criteria of GCSE and A Levels mid-course.

rejection.details: This issue is the responsibility of Ofqual, the regulator of qualifications, examinations and assessments in England.  Ofqual is independent of Government.
